Obama burning midnight oil in his reelection campaign

President Obama has kept long days lately, often due to fund-raising efforts, begging the question of whether he is tiring himself out for his day job. (Globe, 1:51 p.m.)

A quiet evening in a Boxford backyard took an "udderly" dramatic turn when some bovines dropped by to have brews.

Soldiers' families plant flags on Common

About 200 volunteers planted 33,000 flags on the Boston Common today to represent Massachusetts soldiers killed since the Civil War. (Globe, 3:16 p.m.)

Harvard apologizes for Unabomber listing

The Harvard Alumni Association has apologized for the Ted Kaczynski entry in its class of 1962 report, which lists eight life sentences as his "awards." (Globe, 1:15 p.m.)
